page.title: 12HOUSING IN SIBLE HEDINGHAM
page.content: There are six{estates,}which are called Hawkwood,Parkfields,Brook Meadow,Sugar Loaves,Christmas Fields and Oxford Meadow. They are small {estates}compared with those in Braintree . Houses on the{estates}are mostly modern style. The four main types are detached,semi-detached, terraced and bungalows. There are lots of{old houses}in Potter Street and Alderford Street. Some houses are about 300 years old and have wooden beams and plaster but some have bricks at the bottom of the house and wood and plaster at the top. In the countryside there are lots of{farm houses}with buildings round them,big gardens and three have moats. In Potter Street there are some {Alms houses}where people who couldn't pay rent lived for as long as they liked.These are being renovated.
